producers.name: Barkham, M., Mullin, T., Connell, J., et al.

title_statement.title: CORE-10: Clinical Outcomes in Routine Evaluation
title_statement.subtitle: 10-item self-report outcome measure for psychological distress

study_info.abstract: The CORE-10 is a brief 10-item self-report measure of psychological distress and wellbeing. It assesses general mental health, functioning, and risk. Widely used in UK routine outcome monitoring for counseling and psychotherapy services. Items are rated on a 5-point frequency scale over the past week.

instrument_details.full_name: Clinical Outcomes in Routine Evaluation - 10 items
instrument_details.interpretation: 0-9: Healthy; 10-14: Low level of distress; 15-19: Moderate distress; 20-24: Moderate to severe distress; 25+: Severe distress

psychometric_properties.validity: Good sensitivity to change and discrimination between clinical and non-clinical populations

questions.question_text: I have felt tense, anxious or nervous
I have felt I have had someone to talk to about things that matter to me
I have felt able to cope when things go wrong
I have been troubled by aches, pains or other physical problems
I have had trouble with sleep
I have felt unhappy or depressed
I have had difficulty with concentration
I have felt able to make decisions about important things
I have had feelings I could not control
I have felt I have no reason for being
